page.title: 05Village Amenities - (2)
page.content: The village{Church}is probably the only continuous link with the original Domesday Survey. Petham has become a sought after {residential area}for the retired and those working in Canterbury.{Car {ownership}is, of necessity, high and the city with its extensive facilities is little more than ten minute's journey away. The{small amount of {employment}that exists is almost exclusively connected with{agriculture or horticulture. Apart from this the local public houses with eating facilities provide some employment (part-time), as does a large country house converted to a nursing home and the primary school.
